009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
017
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019
020/**
021 * 
022 * WB: numerically potentially more stable solution using Moore-Penrose pseudoinverse (see Chernov book p. 104, eq. 5.12)
023 * Original: Kasa, I., A curve fitting procedure and its error analysis, IEEE Trans. Inst. Meas., 25, 8-14, 1976.
024 * See https://people.cas.uab.edu/~mosya/cl/CircleFitByKasa.cpp (orig code)
025 * http://www.ne.jp/asahi/paleomagnetism.rock-magnetism/basics/pmag/circ/circ1E.html
026 * http://www.ne.jp/asahi/paleomagnetism.rock-magnetism/basics/pmag/circ/circ2E.html
027 * 
028 * @author WB
029 *
030 */
031public class CircleFitKasaB extends CircleFitAlgebraic {
032
033        private final double[] q;       // p = (B,C,D) circle parameters
034        
035        public CircleFitKasaB(Pnt2d[] points) {
036                q = fit(points);
037        }
038        
039        @Override
040        public double[] getParameters() {
041                return new double[] {1, q[0], q[1], q[2]};
042        }
043        
044        
045        
046        /**
047         * Ported from Doube: FitCircle.java (adapted to use Apache Commons Math)
048         *
049         * @author Michael Doube, ported from Nikolai Chernov's MATLAB scripts
050         * @see
051         *      <p>
052         *      Al-Sharadqha & Chernov (2009)
053         *      <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1214/09-EJS419"> Error analysis for circle
054         *      fitting algorithms</a>. Electronic Journal of Statistics 3, pp. 886-911
055         *      <br/>
056         *      <br />
057         *      <a href="http://www.math.uab.edu/~chernov/cl/MATLABcircle.html" >http://
058         *      www.math.uab.edu/~chernov/cl/MATLABcircle.html</a>
059         *      </p>
060         *
061         */
062        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] pts) {
063                final int n = pts.length;
064                if (n < 3) {
065                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 3 points are required");
066                }
067                
068                final double[] z = new double[n];
069                final double[][] Xa = new double[n][];
070                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
071                        final double x = pts[i].getX();
072                        final double y = pts[i].getY();
073                        Xa[i] = new double[] {x, y, 1};
074                        z[i] = -(sqr(x) + sqr(y));
075                }
076
077                RealMatrix X = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(Xa);
078                
079                RealMatrix Xi = null;
080                try {
081                        SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(X);
082                        Xi = svd.getSolver().getInverse();              // get (3,N) pseudoinverse of X
083//                      IJ.log("solver = " + svd.getSolver());
084//                      IJ.log("rank X = " + svd.getRank());
085                } catch (SingularMatrixException e) { }
086                
087                if (Xi == null) {
088                        return null;
089                }
090                else {
091                        double[] q = Xi.operate(z);     // solution vector q = X^-1 * z = (B, C, D)
092                        return q;
093                }
094        }
095
096}
